bug.author: shellhue
bug.summary: Segmentation fault: address not mapped to object at address 0x88 when run horovod examples for tf1.14
bug.description:
Environment:
Framework: TensorFlow Framework version: 1.14 Horovod version: 0.16.4 MPI version: openmpi-4.0.1 CUDA version: 10.0 NCCL version: 2.4.7 Python version: 3.6.8 OS and version: ubuntu 16.04 GCC version: 5.4.0
When i run the tensorflow minist example with the cmd below: <denchmark-code># horovod repository is located at user home directory # horovod repository is at commit 35b55c5 cd ~/horovod/examples horovodrun -np 8 python tensorflow_minist.py </denchmark-code>
The logging info is: <denchmark-code>[1,4]<stderr>:WARNING: Logging before flag parsing goes to stderr. [1,4]<stderr>:W0713 17:04:22.895230 140269850093312 deprecation_wrapper.py:119] From /home/huangzeyu/anaconda3/envs/tf1.14/lib/python3.6/site-packages/horovod/tensorflow/__init__.py:107: The name tf.train.SessionRunHook is deprecated. Please use tf.estimator.SessionRunHook instead. [1,4]<stderr>: [1,4]<stderr>:W0713 17:04:22.895446 140269850093312 deprecation_wrapper.py:119] From /home/huangzeyu/anaconda3/envs/tf1.14/lib/python3.6/site-packages/horovod/tensorflow/__init__.py:141: The name tf.train.Optimizer is deprecated. Please use tf.compat.v1.train.Optimizer instead. Please use tf.compat.v1.logging.set_verbosity instead. Please use tf.compat.v1.logging.INFO instead. Per user-direction, the job has been aborted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------- mpirun noticed that process rank 3 with PID 0 on node comput3 exited on signal 11 (Segmentation fault). -------------------------------------------------------------------------- </denchmark-code>
The key error is: <denchmark-code>Caught signal 11 (Segmentation fault: address not mapped to object at address 0x88) </denchmark-code>
I search on google, no lucky results got. Does anyone have any idea? p.s. the pytorch demo works. <denchmark-code># pytorch 1.1.0 horovodrun -np 8 python pytorch_mnist.py </denchmark-code>

comments.comment:
It works for me fine with: TensorFlow 1.14.0 Keras 2.2.4 Horovod <denchmark-link:https://github.com/horovod/horovod/commit/35b55c5169020f716beec436309ae9689404ab7e>35b55c5</denchmark-link>
OpenMPI 4.0.1 CUDA 10.0 NCCL 2.4.7 Python 3.6.8 Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS GCC 4.8.5 & 7.4.0

It works for me fine with: TensorFlow 1.14.0 Keras 2.2.4 Horovod 35b55c5 OpenMPI 4.0.1 CUDA 10.0 NCCL 2.4.7 Python 3.6.8 Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS GCC 4.8.5 & 7.4.0
Your system is a little different from mine. I downgrade tensorflow to tf1.13.1, and it works now.
